thread.title: Canada’s Kadeisha Buchanan on FIFA Ballon d’Or award shortlist
thread.title_full: Canada’s Kadeisha Buchanan on FIFA Ballon d’Or award shortlist | Toronto Star

title: Canada’s Kadeisha Buchanan on FIFA Ballon d’Or award shortlist
text:
ZURICH — Canada’s Kadeisha Buchanan is one of 10 players shortlisted for the 2015 Ballon D’Or award for the women’s world player of the year.
The United States, which won the World Cup in July, is the best represented country on the shortlist with the three players: Hope Solo, Megan Rapinoe and Carli Lloyd.
Brazil’s Marta, who won the award every year from 2006 to 2010 and was the runner-up last year, did not make the shortlist.
John Herdman, coach of Canada’s women’s soccer team was also on the short list of 10 for the women’s team coach of the year award announced Monday.
Players shortlist:
Nadine Angerer (Germany/Brisbane Roar/Portland Thorns) Ramona Bachmann (Switzerland/FC Rosengard)
Kadeisha Buchanan (Canada/West Virginia University)
Amandine Henry (France/Olympique Lyonnais)
Eugenie Le Sommer (France/Olympique Lyonnais)
Carli Lloyd (U.S./Houston Dash)
Aya Miyama (Japan/Okayama Yunogo Belle)
Megan Rapinoe (U.S./Seattle Reign)
Celia Sasic (Germany/1.FFC Frankfurt)
Hope Solo (U.S./Seattle Reign)
